item.title: 'Dilwale' song ‘Premika’ to release on December 25
item.description: If you’ve seen 'Dilwale,' you are obviously wondering what happened to the much-hyped song, ‘Premika,’ which was missing from the film.

Salman appeal put off for lack of translated documents
item.description: The Bombay HC on Wednesday adjourned to July 13 the appeal filed by actor Salman Khan against his conviction for culpable homicide not amounting to murder in the 2002 hit-and-run case in Bandra.

item.title: Spoiler Alert: Me - Climax revealed!
Forty years on, only a handful of films have investigated the Emergency
item.description: Gulzar’s Aandhi was banned. Film Kissa Kursi Ka’s print was burnt. Kishore Kumar’s songs went off the air.

item.title: Kissa Kursi Ka: Government mulls returning prints or compensating filmmaker’s kin
item.description: Forty years after controversial film, Kissa Kursi Ka—a satire on former PM Indira Gandhi and the Emergency — was banned and its prints burnt, the information and broadcasting (I&B) ministry has said that it is considering an appeal for either returning the prints or compensating the filmmaker’s son.

item.title: Mithun Chakraborty surrenders Rs 1.2cr received from Saradha to ED
item.description: During his last questioning by ED here in May, Chakraborty had provided the agency sleuths with a number of DVDs, CDs and scripts that he had got as part of being the brand ambassador of the Saradha group.

item.title: Sangeeta Bijlani: Sangeeta uncomfortable doing lovemaking-kissing scenes, quits comeback movie
item.description: Onir’s Shab was being touted as Sangeeta Bijlani’s Bollywood comeback after a hiatus of two decades, but the feisty actress has backed out of it. Reason — the one-time screen scorcher is uncomfortable with the kissing, lovemaking and other intimate scenes that are an integral part of the script.

item.title: Whatever I am today is because of tV: Siddharth Shukla
item.description: Actor Siddharth Shukla, who will be making his filmy debut soon, credits his success to TV shows

item.title: 'The Revenant' wins big in Britain's BAFTA awards
item.description: Survival drama 'The Revenant' was the top winner at Britain's biggest movie awards on Sunday, taking the best film prize and honours for leading actor Leonardo DiCaprio and director Alejandro Gonzalez Inarritu.

item.title: Actor Vivek loses 13-year-old son to dengue, brain fever
item.description: Tamil actor Vivek’s son Prasanna Kumar, 13, died in a city hospital on Thursday of complications arising out of dengue and brain fever. He was undergoing treatment at the hospital for more than a month.

item.title: 'She was always there for us’
item.description: She was all of 12 years the day Sharmila Tagore had first visited the Ray residence. A schoolgirl wearing a frock with a curly crop of shoulder-length hair, Sharmila had an urban look that hardly resembled the image Satyajit Ray had in mind for Aparna in ‘Apur Sansar’.

item.title: SikhNet To Launch Free Online Animated Story 'Kaur'

item.title: Marathi film leaked online, producer lodges complaint
item.description: Hardly a week after the release of Marathi film ‘Dagadi Chawl’ on October 10, most parts of the film have been uploaded illegally on YouTube. Producer of the film, Suresh Sawant, has lodged an FIR with the Bandra-Kurla Complex cyber police for cheating, fraud and copyright.

item.title: ‘Court’ actress Geetanjali Kulkarni: I appreciate experimental films
item.description: Chaintanya Tamhane’s critically acclaimed Marathi film Court has been selected as India’s official entry to the Best Foreign Language category of the 2016 Academy Awards.

item.title: Mohan Joshi is Tanvi's mentor
item.description: Talented actress Tanvi Hegde, who is making her Marathi debut with ‘Dhurandhar Bhatawdekar’ was guided on the sets of the movie by the veteran Mohan Joshi, according to a report.

item.title: Sena slams BJP minister for watering down 'prime-time' rule
item.description: Slamming the Maharashtra cultural affairs minister Vinod Tawde for redefining the 'prime-time' for screening of Marathi films in multiplexes between 12 pm to 9 pm, the ruling coalition partner Shiv Sena today said Marathi films should get reserved slots of their choice.
